alSlotTable.name: alSlotTable
alSlotTable.description: A table that contains information about each slot in the PowerHub 4k6k7k chassis.

alSlotNumber.name: alSlotNumber
alSlotNumber.description: The slot number for which the following information applies.

alSlotCardType.name: alSlotCardType
alSlotCardType.description: The card type for this slot.

alSlotStatus.name: alSlotStatus
alSlotStatus.description: The status of the card in this slot.

alSlotModel.name: alSlotModel
alSlotModel.description: The model number for this card.

alSlotRevision.name: alSlotRevision
alSlotRevision.description: The revision number for this card.

alSlotIssue.name: alSlotIssue
alSlotIssue.description: The issue number for this slot.

alSlotSerialNumber.name: alSlotSerialNumber
alSlotSerialNumber.description: The serial number of this card this slot.

alSlotPower5.name: alSlotPower5
alSlotPower5.description: The number of milliamps. of current drawn by this slot at 5 Volts.

alSlotPower12.name: alSlotPower12
alSlotPower12.description: The number of milliamps. of current drawn by this slot at 12 Volts.

alSlotPower33.name: alSlotPower33
alSlotPower33.description: The number of milliamps. of current drawn by this slot at 3.3 Volts.

alSlotPowerOther.name: alSlotPowerOther
alSlotPowerOther.description: The number of milliamps. of current drawn by this slot at OTHER voltage.

alVportTable.name: alVportTable
alVportTable.description: A table that contains information about each virtual port in the PowerHub 4k6k7k chassis. This table differs from the alSlotToVportTable mainly in how this table is indexed.

alVportEntry.name: alVportEntry
alVportEntry.description: Information about a specific virtual port.

alVportNumber.name: alVportNumber
alVportNumber.description: The virtual port number for which the following information applies.

alVportSlotNumber.name: alVportSlotNumber
alVportSlotNumber.description: The slot number which holds the physical port that corresponds to the virtual port of interest.

alVportPortNumber.name: alVportPortNumber
alVportPortNumber.description: The physical port number on the slot that corresponds to this virtual port number, identified by alVportNumber.

alVportPortType.name: alVportPortType
alVportPortType.description: The port type for this virtual port.

alVportStatus.name: alVportStatus
alVportStatus.description: The port status for this virtual port.

alVportControllerType.name: alVportControllerType
alVportControllerType.description: The controller type for this virtual port.

alVportDataRateConfig.name: alVportDataRateConfig
alVportDataRateConfig.description: The data rate requested for this virtual port.

alVportOperModeConfig.name: alVportOperModeConfig
alVportOperModeConfig.description: The operating mode requested for this virtual port.

alVportAutoNegotiateConfig.name: alVportAutoNegotiateConfig
alVportAutoNegotiateConfig.description: The auto-negotiation requested for this virtual port.

alVportDataRateStatus.name: alVportDataRateStatus
alVportDataRateStatus.description: The actual data rate for this virtual port.

alVportOperModeStatus.name: alVportOperModeStatus
alVportOperModeStatus.description: The actual operating mode for this virtual port.

alSlotToVportTable.name: alSlotToVportTable
alSlotToVportTable.description: A table that contains information about each port of each slot in the PowerHub 4k6k7k chassis. This table is established as a way to specify the information about a physical port located on a slot in the PowerHub 4k6k7k chassis. This table a slot and port number scheme. This table differs from uses two indices (the slot number and the port number) to identify a port.

alSlotVportEntry.name: alSlotVportEntry
alSlotVportEntry.description: Information about a specific port in a specific slot. The slot number and the port number in that slot (numbered left to right in ascending order) identifies a specific port.

alSlotVportSlotNumber.name: alSlotVportSlotNumber
alSlotVportSlotNumber.description: The slot number which holds the port of interest.

alSlotVportPortNumber.name: alSlotVportPortNumber
alSlotVportPortNumber.description: The physical port number on a slot which represents the port of interest. The physical port is numbered from left to right in a slot.

alSlotVportNumber.name: alSlotVportNumber
alSlotVportNumber.description: The virtual port number which corresponds to the port that is identified by the slot and port number. This scheme thereby relates each virtual port to a slot and physical port tuplet.

alSlotVportPortType.name: alSlotVportPortType
alSlotVportPortType.description: The port type for this port.

alSlotVportControllerType.name: alSlotVportControllerType
alSlotVportControllerType.description: The controller type for this port.

alSlotVportDataRateConfig.name: alSlotVportDataRateConfig
alSlotVportDataRateConfig.description: The data rate requested for this port. The actual data rate may be different from the requested data rate.

alSlotVportOperModeConfig.name: alSlotVportOperModeConfig
alSlotVportOperModeConfig.description: The operating mode requested for this port.

alSlotVportAutoNegotiateConfig.name: alSlotVportAutoNegotiateConfig
alSlotVportAutoNegotiateConfig.description: The auto-negotiation requested for this port.

alSlotVportDataRateStatus.name: alSlotVportDataRateStatus
alSlotVportDataRateStatus.description: The actual data rate for this port.

alSlotVportOperModeStatus.name: alSlotVportOperModeStatus
alSlotVportOperModeStatus.description: The actual operating mode for this port.

alPSTable.name: alPSTable
alPSTable.description: A table that contains information about each power supply in the PowerHub 4k6k7k chassis.

alPSEntry.name: alPSEntry
alPSEntry.description: Information about a specific power supply.

alPSStatus.name: alPSStatus
alPSStatus.description: The status of the power supply identified by the instance of alPSNumber.

alCpuSlot.name: alCpuSlot
alCpuSlot.description: The slot number in which the packet engine resides

alSlotChassis.name: alSlotChassis
alSlotChassis.description: The maximum number of slots available in the powerhub. Presently it could either be a 5, 10, or 15 slot chassis. This object is used only for PH7000.

powerFailure.name: powerFailure
powerFailure.description: The powerFailure trap indicates that powerFailure occured in the particular powersupply unit.

boardFailure.name: boardFailure
boardFailure.description: The boardFailure trap indicates that intelligent card failure occured in the particular slot.

alChassisType.name: alChassisType
alChassisType.description: The model type of the PowerHub

alMcpuRtVer.name: alMcpuRtVer
alMcpuRtVer.description: Runtime software version of the motherboard CPU; it is an ASCII string that describes the version as well as the date and time the software was released from the factory.

alMcpuPromVer.name: alMcpuPromVer
alMcpuPromVer.description: PROM software version of the motherboard CPU; it is an ASCII string that describes the version as well as the date and time the software was released from the factory.

alFcpuOneRtVer.name: alFcpuOneRtVer
alFcpuOneRtVer.description: Runtime software version of F-bus CPU for the first FDDI board.

alFcpuTwoRtVer.name: alFcpuTwoRtVer
alFcpuTwoRtVer.description: Runtime software version of F-bus CPU for the second FDDI board.

alFcpuOnePromVer.name: alFcpuOnePromVer
alFcpuOnePromVer.description: PROM software version of F-bus CPU for the first FDDI board.

alFcpuTwoPromVer.name: alFcpuTwoPromVer
alFcpuTwoPromVer.description: PROM software version of F-bus CPU for the second FDDI board.

alRcpuOneRtVer.name: alRcpuOneRtVer
alRcpuOneRtVer.description: Runtime software version of Ring CPU for the first FDDI board.

alRcpuTwoRtVer.name: alRcpuTwoRtVer
alRcpuTwoRtVer.description: Runtime software version of Ring CPU for the second FDDI board.

alRcpuOnePromVer.name: alRcpuOnePromVer
alRcpuOnePromVer.description: PROM software version of Ring CPU for the first FDDI board.

alRcpuTwoPromVer.name: alRcpuTwoPromVer
alRcpuTwoPromVer.description: PROM software version of Ring CPU for the second FDDI board.

alLastLoginFailureTimeDate.name: alLastLoginFailureTimeDate
alLastLoginFailureTimeDate.description: Time and date string of the last login session that failed.

alLastLoginFailureUserId.name: alLastLoginFailureUserId
alLastLoginFailureUserId.description: User id of the last login session that failed.

alLastLoginFailureReason.name: alLastLoginFailureReason
alLastLoginFailureReason.description: Reason code for the last login failure.

alLastLoginSourceAddress.name: alLastLoginSourceAddress
alLastLoginSourceAddress.description: Source address of the last login session that failed. The value would be either 'console' or ipaddress string of the telnet session.

alLoginFailure.name: alLoginFailure
alLoginFailure.description: The login failure trap indicates that the login failed due to some error condition during the login process.

alConsoleSyslogLevel.name: alConsoleSyslogLevel
alConsoleSyslogLevel.description: Level which generates a logging messsage for console port commands (telnet, tip, etc.); no messages if set to off(1).

alSnmpSyslogLevel.name: alSnmpSyslogLevel
alSnmpSyslogLevel.description: Level which generates a logging messsage for snmp induced changes; no messages if set to off(1).

alIlmiSyslogLevel.name: alIlmiSyslogLevel
alIlmiSyslogLevel.description: Level which generates a logging messsage for ilmi configuration changes; no messages if set to off(1).

alSyslogHostType.name: alSyslogHostType
alSyslogHostType.description: Host which receives syslog messages: notSet(1) if no host is set or becomes unset; local(2) if messages go to console; ip(3) if messages go to a remote host

alSyslogHostIp.name: alSyslogHostIp
alSyslogHostIp.description: IP address of remote host which receives syslog messages; must be set if alSyslogHost is set to ip.

alSyslogHostIpFacility.name: alSyslogHostIpFacility
alSyslogHostIpFacility.description: Syslog facility to be assigned to all syslog messages. Default is daemon(1).

alBridgeTable.name: alBridgeTable
alBridgeTable.description: A table that contains information about unicast entries for which the bridge has forwarding and/or filtering information. This information is used by the transparent bridging function in determining how to propagate a received frame.

alBridgeEntry.name: alBridgeEntry
alBridgeEntry.description: Information about a specific unicast MAC address for which the bridge has some forwarding and/or filtering information.

alBridgeEntryAddress.name: alBridgeEntryAddress
alBridgeEntryAddress.description: The MAC address for which the bridge has forwarding and/or filtering information.

alBridgeEntryPort.name: alBridgeEntryPort
alBridgeEntryPort.description: The port number of the port on which a frame having a source address equal to the value of the corresponding instance of alBridgeEntryAddress has been seen.

alBridgeEntryLink.name: alBridgeEntryLink
alBridgeEntryLink.description: The link number on the port on which a frame having as ource address equal to the value of the corresponding instance of alBridgeEntryAddress has been seen. Only applies to the UTP port type.

alBridgeEntryRule.name: alBridgeEntryRule
alBridgeEntryRule.description: The rule number that is applied to packets that are forwarded to or from this address.

alBridgeTblClear.name: alBridgeTblClear
alBridgeTblClear.description: When set, clears the Bridge table.

portStatsPort.name: portStatsPort
portStatsPort.description: Segment for which the statistics collected.

portStatsPktsIn.name: portStatsPktsIn
portStatsPktsIn.description: Good packets received on the segment. Packets are listed regardless of packet type, or whether the packet is forwarded to another segment. Error packets are not listed.

portStatsPktsOut.name: portStatsPktsOut
portStatsPktsOut.description: Packets transmitted on the segment. This statistic is incremented when a packet is scheduled for transmission, not when it is actually transmitted.

portStatsOctetsIn.name: portStatsOctetsIn
portStatsOctetsIn.description: Good octets received on the segment. This statistic includes 8 octets per packet to account for the preamble.

portStatsOctetsOut.name: portStatsOctetsOut
portStatsOctetsOut.description: Octets transmitted from the segment. This statistic is incremented when a packet is scheduled for transmission, not when it is actually transmitted. This statistic includes 8 octets per packet to account for the preamble.

portStatsMulticastPktsIn.name: portStatsMulticastPktsIn
portStatsMulticastPktsIn.description: Broadcast multicast packets received on the segment. This statistic is incremented for each good broadcast or multicast packet received on the segment.

portStatsMulticastPktsOut.name: portStatsMulticastPktsOut
portStatsMulticastPktsOut.description: Broadcast multicast packets transmitted from the segment. This statistic is incremented once for each broadcast or multicast packet scheduled for transmission on the segment.

portStatsTableMisses.name: portStatsTableMisses
portStatsTableMisses.description: Packets received that have unknown destination addresses. When address learning is enabled, this statistic is usually incremented only for the first packet transmitted to a workstation or other device connected to the segment. After a reply is received, the device's source address is added to the bridging table.

portStatsRcvBuffErrs.name: portStatsRcvBuffErrs
portStatsRcvBuffErrs.description: Incremented each time the hub detects an incoming packet but does not have a buffer in which to store the packet.

portStatsXmitBuffErrs.name: portStatsXmitBuffErrs
portStatsXmitBuffErrs.description: Incremented each time the hub attempts to forward a packet to a busy destination segment whose output buffers all are full.

portStatsTotalCollisions.name: portStatsTotalCollisions
portStatsTotalCollisions.description: The total number of collisions detected on the segment while attempting to transmit and receive packets. For FDDI segments, this statistic is always 0.

portStatsRcvCollisions.name: portStatsRcvCollisions
portStatsRcvCollisions.description: The number of collisions detected on the segment while listening for incoming packets. This statistic is only available for UTP segments. For segments on other module types, this statistic is always 0.

portStatsXmitCollisions.name: portStatsXmitCollisions
portStatsXmitCollisions.description: The number of collisions detected on the segment while attempting to transmit packets. For FDDI segments, this statistic is always 0.

portStatsXmitQLen.name: portStatsXmitQLen
portStatsXmitQLen.description: The number of outgoing packets in the transmit queue. These packets have been scheduled for transmission, but have not been transmitted yet.

portStatsPeakUtilization.name: portStatsPeakUtilization
portStatsPeakUtilization.description: The segment's maximum utilization during a one-second interval since the statistics last were cleared. For Ethernet segments, the current utilization is calculated as follows: Once per second, the current one- second utilization is computed as (total # octets) x (8 bits/octets) / 10 Mb/s. The peak utilization is then set to the maximum of the current one-second utilization and the previous peak utilization. NOTE: Total # octets is all octets transmitted and received on the segment during the previous second, including 8 octets of preamble per packet. The Ethernet rate is 10Mb.

portStatsCurrUtilization.name: portStatsCurrUtilization
portStatsCurrUtilization.description: For Ethernet segments, the current utilization is calculated as follows: Once per second, the current one-second utilization is computed as (total # octets) x (8 bits/octets) / 10 Mb/s. NOTE: Total # octets is all octets transmitted and received on the segment during the previous second, including 8 octets of preamble per packet. The Ethernet rate is 10Mb.

portStatsLossOfCarrier.name: portStatsLossOfCarrier
portStatsLossOfCarrier.description: Indicates that an AUI segment has no cable attached, or the cable or transceiver is faulty.

portStatsExcessRetries.name: portStatsExcessRetries
portStatsExcessRetries.description: Incremented whenever all of 15 attempts to transmit a single packet cause collisions. This can happen in very busy networks, or when no cable is attached to an enabled BNC port.

alBridgeStatsClear.name: alBridgeStatsClear
alBridgeStatsClear.description: When set, clears the statistics for the bridge. When not set, value 0 is returned.

alBridgePPControl.name: alBridgePPControl
alBridgePPControl.description: When set to 3 , disables the port to port collection of the stats; when set to 1, enables the port to port stats collection; when set to 2, clears the port to port stats.

alPortToPortTable.name: alPortToPortTable
alPortToPortTable.description: Statistics for port to port traffic.

portToPortEntry.name: portToPortEntry
portToPortEntry.description: Statistics for port to port traffic

alPortConfigTable.name: alPortConfigTable
alPortConfigTable.description: Per port configuration for configuring Source and Destination Rules etc.

portConfigPort.name: portConfigPort
portConfigPort.description: The port number for this table entry

portConfigSrcRule.name: portConfigSrcRule
portConfigSrcRule.description: Source Rule for the port number identified by the instance of portConfigPort

portConfigDstRule.name: portConfigDstRule
portConfigDstRule.description: Destination Rule for the port number identified by the instance of portConfigPort

portConfigBlockLearnedEntries.name: portConfigBlockLearnedEntries
portConfigBlockLearnedEntries.description: When set to True (1), the port identified by the instance of portConfigPort will block the learned entries; if set to False (2) the port will not block the learned entries

alBridgeIpBridging.name: alBridgeIpBridging
alBridgeIpBridging.description: When set to enable(1), enables the IP bridging and if set to disable(2), disables the IP bridging.

brTemplateNumber.name: brTemplateNumber
brTemplateNumber.description: The number of the template with which it is identified.

brTemplateOffset.name: brTemplateOffset
brTemplateOffset.description: A displacement, in octets, from the beginning of the packet. This must be a multiple of 4 in the range from 0 to 124 decimal. A value of -1 will delete the entry

brTemplateMask.name: brTemplateMask
brTemplateMask.description: A 4-byte (32-bit) number, normally specified as eight hexadecimal digits (00000000 - ffffffff) Description: The bytes in the mask are numbered from 0 to 3, starting with the high-order byte (big-endian format). Each byte of the mask is ANDed with the octet in the packet at displacement 'offset + i' to form a 4-byte 'masked value'.

brTemplateComparator.name: brTemplateComparator
brTemplateComparator.description: A 4-byte number, usually specified as eight hexadecimal digits (00000000 - ffffffff) Description: If the masked value defined above equals the comparator, then the template returns a value of 'true'; otherwise, it returns a value of 'false'.

brTemplateOption.name: brTemplateOption
brTemplateOption.description: Setting this value to 0 assume all 32 bits mask and comparator specified; value 1 assume half-word (2 bytes) qunatity; and value 2 assume single-byte quantity.

brRuleNumber.name: brRuleNumber
brRuleNumber.description: A rule number in the range 101-162. You can define up to 62 rules.

brRuleStatement.name: brRuleStatement
brRuleStatement.description: Specifies the templates and the logical operators that make up the rule. Rule statements consist of rule numbers joined by the following logical operators: Operator Means... & AND | OR ~ NOT Rule statements are interpreted from left to right. Use parentheses to group expressions. You can use up to eight sets of parentheses to group template numbers and logical operators. The total maximum number of characters, including blanks, is 64.

brRuleToNodePort.name: brRuleToNodePort
brRuleToNodePort.description: The number of the port for which this rule applies

brRuleToNodeRule.name: brRuleToNodeRule
brRuleToNodeRule.description: The rule number that applies to this entry.

brGroupNumber.name: brGroupNumber
brGroupNumber.description: The group number by which the group is identified with.

brGroupPortsMask.name: brGroupPortsMask
brGroupPortsMask.description: The ports associated with the group number identified by the instance of brGroupNumber. The mask is ascii segments separated by commas. A value of -1 would invalidate the appropriate group.

brGroupName.name: brGroupName
brGroupName.description: The name of the group for which this entry applies

alBridgeSTPControl.name: alBridgeSTPControl
alBridgeSTPControl.description: When set to 2 , disables the spanning tree. set to 1, enables the spanning tree.

alPortStateTable.name: alPortStateTable
alPortStateTable.description: Per port state information about spanning tree, dignostics and management.

portStatePort.name: portStatePort
portStatePort.description: The port number for this table entry

portStateDiag.name: portStateDiag
portStateDiag.description: The diagnostics state of the port

portStateMgmt.name: portStateMgmt
portStateMgmt.description: The management state of the port

portStateStp.name: portStateStp
portStateStp.description: The spanning tree state of the port.

autoPortStatePort.name: autoPortStatePort
autoPortStatePort.description: The port number for this table entry

autoPortState.name: autoPortState
autoPortState.description: Whether the auto port state detection is turned on or not.

autoPortStateThreshold.name: autoPortStateThreshold
autoPortStateThreshold.description: Corresponding to the threshold parameter of the autoportstate command.

alLinkStatsCollect.name: alLinkStatsCollect
alLinkStatsCollect.description: When set to enable(1), per link stats collection is enabled; when set to disable(0), the per link stats are not collected.

alLinkStatsClear.name: alLinkStatsClear
alLinkStatsClear.description: When set, clears the link stats; otherwise value 0 is returned.

linkStatsBMCastPktsIn.name: linkStatsBMCastPktsIn
linkStatsBMCastPktsIn.description: Bmcast Pks In - corresponds to bpi

linkStatsCodingErrors.name: linkStatsCodingErrors
linkStatsCodingErrors.description: This Counter is incremented when the receiver (RX) port detects an invalid symbol in the incoming code sent by the TX port using symbol mode.

linkStatsDataRateMismatch.name: linkStatsDataRateMismatch
linkStatsDataRateMismatch.description: This counter is incremented by one for each frame received on this port that meets all of the following conditions: 1) The Collision Event signal is not asserted 2) The Activity duration is greater than ValidPacketMinTime 3) The frequency (data rate) is detectably mismatched from the local transmit frequency

linkStatsJabbers.name: linkStatsJabbers
linkStatsJabbers.description: This Counter is incremented for each CarrierEvent on this port whose ActivityDuration is greater than the MAU Jabber Lockup Protection timer

linkStatsShortEvents.name: linkStatsShortEvents
linkStatsShortEvents.description: This counter is incremented for each CarrierEvent on this port with ActivityDuration less than ShortEventMaxTime.

linkStatsRunts.name: linkStatsRunts
linkStatsRunts.description: An event whose length is greater than 74 bit times but less than 82 bit times shall increment either the shortEvents counter or the runts counter but not both

linkStatsPortCollision.name: linkStatsPortCollision
linkStatsPortCollision.description: This counter is incremented for any CarrierEvent signal on any port for which the CollisionEvent signal on this port is also asserted.

linkStatsLateCollision.name: linkStatsLateCollision
linkStatsLateCollision.description: This counter is incremented for each CarrierEvent on this port in which the CollIn(X) variable transitions to the value SQE while the ActivityDuration is greater than the LAteEventThreshold.

linkStatsAutoPartition.name: linkStatsAutoPartition
linkStatsAutoPartition.description: This counter is incremented each time the repeater has automatically partitioned this port

linkStatsIsolates.name: linkStatsIsolates
linkStatsIsolates.description: This counter is incremented whenever the port detects two consecutive carrier integrity false carriers.

linkStatsSaFieldChanges.name: linkStatsSaFieldChanges
linkStatsSaFieldChanges.description: This counter is incremented for each time that the rptrAddrTrackLastSourceAddress attribute for this port has changed.

linkStatsLastSa.name: linkStatsLastSa
linkStatsLastSa.description: This object is the SourceAddress of the last readable frame received by this port.

linkControlEnlState.name: linkControlEnlState
linkControlEnlState.description: Setting the value of this object to Enable (1) will enable the link and setting to Disable(2) will disable the link.

linkControlLinkTest.name: linkControlLinkTest
linkControlLinkTest.description: Link test status for the link; corresponds to lt option of the lkd command.

portLinkPort.name: portLinkPort
portLinkPort.description: The port number for which the port type is to be set

alFiberStatsTable.name: alFiberStatsTable
alFiberStatsTable.description: Per port fiber stats and Fiber Security

fiberStatsPort.name: fiberStatsPort
fiberStatsPort.description: The fiber port for which the stats are requested or the Fiber violation is set

fiberAuiStatus.name: fiberAuiStatus
fiberAuiStatus.description: The fiber aui status for the port that is specified by the instance of fiberStatsPort

fiberSecurityViolation.name: fiberSecurityViolation
fiberSecurityViolation.description: The fiber port for which the stats are requested or the Fiber violation is set

alPortMonitorClose.name: alPortMonitorClose
alPortMonitorClose.description: Setting the value to close(1), will turn the port monitoring off.

portMonSrcPort.name: portMonSrcPort
portMonSrcPort.description: The traffic to/from this port will be monitored on the portMonDstPort

portMonDstPort.name: portMonDstPort
portMonDstPort.description: The traffic to/from portMonSrcPort will be monitored on this port

portMonTrafficType.name: portMonTrafficType
portMonTrafficType.description: Setting this value to 1, will let the port monitor monitor forwarded traffic; setting to 8 means the forwarded traffic will not be monitored.

alReboot.name: alReboot
alReboot.description: Setting the value to Reboot(1), will reboot the PowerHub.

portMonViewSrcPort.name: portMonViewSrcPort
portMonViewSrcPort.description: The traffic from this port to the port designated by portMonViewDstPort will be monitored on portMonViewMonitorPort.

portMonViewDstPort.name: portMonViewDstPort
portMonViewDstPort.description: The traffic to this port from the port designated by portMonViewSrcPort will be monitored on portMonViewMonitorPort.

portMonViewMonitorPort.name: portMonViewMonitorPort
portMonViewMonitorPort.description: The traffic to portMonViewDstPort from the port designated by portMonViewSrcPort will be monitored on portMonViewMonitorPort. The mask is ascii, segments separated by commas.

alCfgLocalMediaScope.name: alCfgLocalMediaScope
alCfgLocalMediaScope.description: This object display the types of local media currently available on the PH for storing files. The PH4000 and PH6000 do not support floppy whereas the PH3000 and PH5000 do not support flash. The flash is optional on PH6000 & PH7000. All models do support tftpHost save options. Depending on the value of this object, the user can specify the appropriate filename and the media type in other objects for doing the save operation.

alCfgMediaName.name: alCfgMediaName
alCfgMediaName.description: This object specify the medium name to which the the powerhub will save the configurations. The value 'none' is returned when user have not set the valid save medium. Save operation cannot be performed when value is set to 'none'.

alCfgTftpHostAddr.name: alCfgTftpHostAddr
alCfgTftpHostAddr.description: This object specify the IP address of the tftp host system to which the configs get saved when the object alCfgMediaName is set with value tftpHost(3).

alCfgFileName.name: alCfgFileName
alCfgFileName.description: This object specify the configuration filename to which the PH will save the configuration. Depending on the medium (floppy, flash, or tftpHost) in which the saving will be done, the filename have to be set correctly. For example, the filename for floppy and flash medium cannot exceed 8 characters. The filnames can be appended with the optional dot character followed by 3 character extension. The filenames for tftp host should have been pre-created on the host and it should be writable by the PH. All tftp file access restrictions apply.

alCfgSaveOp.name: alCfgSaveOp
alCfgSaveOp.description: Save config operation can be performed only when this object is set to value '1'. This field returns a dummy value 100 for get operations.

On host samy-ThinkPad-T495s platform Linux version 5.8.0-50-generic by user root
